result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Tyler

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

8:53 AM - case called.  Attorney John Zich in court for Edward Tyler.  Attorney Andrew Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin - victim rights scheduling conference; no victim wishes to be heard.  Statement by the Court - off the record scheduling with Judicial Assistant.
Status conference on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:39 PM - case called.  Attorney John Zich appeared by video for Edward Tyler.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin - victim rights scheduling conference; no victim wishes to be heard.  Statement by the Court - off the record scheduling with Judicial Assistant.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:40 PM - case called.  Attorney John Zich in court for Edward Tyler.  Attorney Andrew Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin - victim rights scheduling conference; no victim wishes to be heard.  Statement by the Court - off the record scheduling with Judicial Assistant.
Status conference on April 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:00 AM - case called.  Defendant Edward Tyler in court.  Attorney John Zich in court for Edward Tyler.  Attorney Galen Bayne-Allison in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Sgt. Investigator Kevin Orzech duly sworn and testifies.  Defendant identified by Sgt. Investigator Orzech.  No cross by Atty Zich.  State moves for bind over.  No argument by Atty Zich.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  Statement by Atty Zich - requests a reserve waiver hearing.  Court has accepted the Information filed by the State.  Discussions regarding scheduling.  Bond will continue.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
to Produce - Preliminary Hearing on 3-30-22 at 10:00 a.m.
Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No violent or abusive contact with the victim(s) while in custody.  Upon release no contact with the victim(s).

1:46 PM - case called.  Defendant Edward Tyler appeared by video, in custody from Mendota.  Attorney John Zich for Edward Tyler appeared by video.  Attorney Kurt Zengler for State of Wisconsin appeared in court.  Statement by Atty Zich - in receipt of complaint - waive reading.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Argument by State as to bond.  State will prepare the Order to Produce.
Return of property hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
